title: Revelation 19: The Second Coming of Christ
short_title: Revelation 19: The Second Coming of Christ
content: The final event that occurs in the destruction of Babylon and all it stands for is the coming of the “King of Kings, and Lord of Lords” (
), who is Jesus Christ, to take the beast and cast him out. An account of this event is found in
. John first began recording this event in

—The Marriage and Marriage Supper of the Lamb
we read that the Church is symbolized by a woman. On more than one occasion Jesus referred to Himself as the groom who marries the woman (see
). This symbolic marriage reminds us that we have a covenant relationship with the Lord and that He cares for the Church as a perfect husband in whom we can rely and trust (see

The marriage supper is a feast celebrating the marriage. The image of a feast reminds us that the gospel of Jesus Christ satisfies the spiritual, emotional, social, and physical hunger, or needs, of the entire posterity of Adam and Eve. Inviting others and preparing for this great supper is an important message of the latter days (see
Two suppers are spoken of in

. They are not the same, although they occur at a similar time in the history of the earth. The first, the marriage supper of the Lamb, is referred to in the preceding section. The other supper, “the supper of the great God” (v. 17), is a symbol that reminds us of the destruction of the wicked. Furthermore, it reminds us that if we put our trust in the things of this world and refuse to believe in life after death, the only future we will look forward to is the same as all other living things on earth—we will die, begin to rot, and birds of prey will eat our flesh. In contrast, the gospel proclaims victory from the grave and the opportunity for eternal happiness.
